item.title: Jonalyn, tanggapin kaya ng kaniyang nobyong 'Afam' kapag nalamang isa siyang hermaphrodite?
item.description: xxHindi tulad sa pangkaraniwang mga tao, ipinanganak na may Hermaproditism o nagtataglay ng ari ng parehong sa babae at lalaki si Jonalyn Bulado ng Isabela. Matanggap kaya ng kaniyang nobyong Amerikano ang pambihira niyang kondisyon?

item.title: Hatid Tulong Program to implement pocket send-off for LSIs --Encabo
item.description: As the Hatid Tulong Program resumed on Thursday, lead convenor Presidential Management Staff Assistant Secretary Joseph Encabo said that they will start to implement a “pocket send-off” approach for the next batches of locally stranded individuals (LSIs) to avoid overcrowding.

item.title: Faster procurement of COVID-19 vaccines assured in Bayanihan 2 --Angara
item.description: "Sa kasalukuyang batas, sa Universal Health Care, kailangan hanggang Stage 4 trial. Medyo matagal 'yun. So dito inilagay natin kahit wala pa 'yung Stage 4 trials for the duration of COVID-19, basta na-certify na ng World Health Organization, puwede na mag-advance procurement," Angara said.

item.title: AO35 Secretariat recommends probe on Zara Alvarez slay, DOJ exec says
item.description: "The AO35 Secretariat today recommended the inclusion of the Zara Alvarez case in the docket of the task force," Justice Undersecretary Markk Perete said.

item.title: QC receives new dorms for healthcare workers
item.description: Two cluster dormitories were turned over to the Quezon City local government which will serve as accommodation facilities for medical personnel.

item.title: 2-anyos na lalaki na may COVID-19, na-intubate at namatay sa Bohol
item.description: Pumanaw sa edad na dalawang taon ang pinakabatang pasyenteng may COVID-19 sa Bohol.

item.title: Russian opposition politician Navalny in coma after suspected poisoning --spokesperson
item.description: Russian opposition politician Alexei Navalny was in a coma in a Siberian hospital on Thursday after drinking a cup of tea that his spokeswoman said she believed was laced with poison.

item.title: Palace to Gapay: Let DOJ probe on killings of soldiers in Jolo take its course
item.description: “No less than the President na po ang nangako ng katarungan. At ngayong natapos na po ang imbestigasyon ng NBI at naisampa na ang kaso sa piskalya, hayaan lang po natin ang proseso umusad,” presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said in a televised briefing.

item.title: Isko Moreno shuts down shops selling cosmetics that tagged Manila as part of China
item.description: Manila Mayor Isko Moreno on Thursday ordered the shutdown of several establishments in Divisoria Mall for selling beauty products which listed its Manila address as a "province" of China.

item.title: DENR exec: Suspect to be charged for dumping chemicals in Batangas river
item.description: The Department of Environment and Natural Resources is filing charges against the suspect who dumped chemical wastes into a river in Tuy, Batangas that created huge foam, photos of which had gone viral online after being shared by the police.

item.title: PhilHealth exec says release of IRM to hospitals before June 11 is illegal
item.description: Philippine Health Insurance Corporation (PhilHealth) s release of advance payment claims to hospitals before June 11 is illegal, the state insurer s Senior Vice President Rodolfo Del Rosario, Jr. said Thursday.

item.title: 60-day grace period for loan payments included in Bayanihan 2 --Angara
item.description: "Dati kasi may conditions pa na kailangan under quarantine or under ECQ, wala na 'yun, 60-day grace period talaga. Let's say due siya tomorrow, may 60 days ka na palugit," Senator Sonny Angara said on Thursday.

item.title: Boying Remulla warns PhilHealth exec: Don t take House panel hearings lightly
item.description: Cavite Representative Jesus Crispin "Boying" Remulla on Thursday warned a high-ranking official of the Philippine Health Insurance Corp. (PhilHealth) not to take the ongoing House panel inquiries lightly after he had skipped many of the previous hearings.

item.title: Philippines logs 4,339 new COVID-19 cases, total tops 178,000
item.description: The Philippines now has 178,022 cases of coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) after the Department of Health (DOH) announced 4,339 new infections on Thursday, marking the third straight day in which more than 4,000 new cases were reported.

item.title: Pinagmulan ng dambuhalang bula sa Tuy, Batangas, natukoy na; 2, inaresto
item.description: Ang itinapong kemikal ang itinuturong pinagmulan ng dambuhalang bula na may masangsang na amoy sa Tuy, Batangas nitong Miyerkules.
